definition: to go for a walk in the snow
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
to walk in the snow to view the flowering plum
see 雪泥鴻爪|雪泥鸿爪[xue3 ni2 hong2 zhao3]

sentences.english: The children scrunched through the snow.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们喀嚓喀嚓地踏雪而过。

sentences.english: Lets take a walk in the snow.
Defying cold of winter through the snow.
Romance is a snowy evening you walk back home alone with creaking footsteps.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫是飞雪的黄昏踏雪而归踽踽独行。

sentences.english: It's not so cold today, let's take a walk in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 今天不太冷，咱们去踏雪散散步吧。

sentences.english: Greyfeet Dog, a very royal species.
sentences.chinese: 四蹄踏雪，好象是名种狗呢。

sentences.english: Lett's take a walk in the snow.

definition: to walk in the snow to view the flowering plum
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
Daxue or Great Snow, 21st of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-21st December
the other end of the world/a faraway place
a world of ice and snow
to sing and dance/general term for a round dance
